From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: villa and vil·la

English

[edit]

Proper noun

[edit]

Villa

  1. A surname from Spanish.
  2. (soccer) Aston Villa Football Club, a football club based in Birmingham
    • 2011 October 22, Sam Sheringham, “Aston Villa 1 - 2 West Brom”, in BBC Sport‎[1]:
      Olsson and Herd tussled off the ball at a free-kick before Olsson fell to the ground. Assistant referee Darren Cann signalled for a penalty and Dowd sent Herd off to the amazement of the Villa faithful.

Statistics

[edit]
  • According to the 2010 United States Census, Villa is the 644th most common surname in the United States, belonging to 52,817 individuals. Villa is most common among Hispanic/Latino (88.74%) individuals.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • Viall

Finnish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From a vernacular form of Vilhelm (Germanic forms include Willa, Willi).[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈʋilːɑ/, [ˈʋilːɑ̝]
  • Rhymes: -ilːɑ
  • Syllabification(key): Vil‧la
  • Hyphenation(key): Vil‧la

Proper noun

[edit]

Villa

  1. a Finnish surname

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Villanen

Statistics

[edit]
  • Villa is the 2631st (tied with 11 other surnames) most common surname in Finland, belonging to 301 individuals, according to August 2025 data from the Digital and Population Data Services Agency of Finland.

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Mikkonen, Pirjo; Paikkala, Sirkka (2000), Sukunimet, Helsinki: Otava, →ISBN

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Villa
Wikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian villa, from Latin villa.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Villa f (genitive Villa, plural Villen)

  1. villa

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Villa [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Villa die Villen
genitive einer der Villa der Villen
dative einer der Villa den Villen
accusative eine die Villa die Villen

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Villa” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Villa” in Duden online

Italian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈvil.la/
  • Rhymes: -illa
  • Hyphenation: Vìl‧la

Proper noun

[edit]

Villa m or f by sense

  1. a surname

Further reading

[edit]
  • Stefano Ravara, Mappa dei Cognomi, 2015–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • IPA(key): /ˈbiʝa/ [ˈbi.ʝa]
  • IPA(key): /ˈbiʝa/ [ˈbi.ʝa] (most of Spain and Latin America)
  • IPA(key): /ˈbiʎa/ [ˈbi.ʎa] (rural northern Spain, Andes Mountains, Paraguay, Philippines)
  • IPA(key): /ˈbiʃa/ [ˈbi.ʃa] (Buenos Aires and environs)
  • IPA(key): /ˈbiʒa/ [ˈbi.ʒa] (elsewhere in Argentina and Uruguay)

 
  • Rhymes: -iʝa
  • Rhymes: -iʝa (most of Spain and Latin America)
  • Rhymes: -iʎa (rural northern Spain, Andes Mountains, Paraguay, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -iʃa (Buenos Aires and environs)
  • Rhymes: -iʒa (elsewhere in Argentina and Uruguay)

  • Syllabification: Vi‧lla

Proper noun

[edit]

Villa m or f by sense

  1. a surname

Derived terms

[edit]
  • villismo
  • villista
